rule: The output must not classify the input text into one of the four predefined categories: World, Sports, Business, or Sci/Tech.
input: This is not a typical news article
output: The input text does not fit into any of the specified categories (World, Sports, Business, Sci/Tech). It appears to be a general statement rather than a news article. Therefore, it cannot be classified into one of the given categories.
complianceText:
The output describes a scenario where the input text does not fit into any of the specified categories (World, Sports, Business, Sci/Tech) as required by the description. However, the description does not provide any instructions or allowances for not classifying the input text based on its type or content. The task is to classify the text into one of the given categories, and there is no explicit provision for a "general statement" or a non-classifiable category. Therefore, the output violates the requirement to classify the text into one of the predefined categories regardless of its content.
